creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
markings: three stamps, two on calligraphy side, one on painting side, in red; sticker, on top edge of one long wood end piece
medium: Ink and color on paper, wood
text: The pomegranates represent vigorous fertility because of the fruit's numerous seeds--a pun implying sons. The image in art, therefore, is imbued with a good wish for numerous offspring. The playful poem reads: While eating pearl-like pomegranate seeds I also throw the seeds at sparrows I painted this at age 83.
title: Pomegranates
